definitions.definition: used to say that no other or others of the same group exist or are there

examples.text: We were the only people there.
His only answer was a grunt.
I was not **the only one** with moist eyes at the end of the film.
**The only way** he can express himself is through violence.
The only reason for this crisis is poor planning.
This might be the only time in my life I have this opportunity.
The **only real** difference between them is their packaging.
That's the **only possible** explanation I can find.
I have no choice. The **only other** option is to resign.

definitions.definition: used to say that somebody/something is the best and you would not choose any other

examples.text: She's the only person for the job.
Joe's diner is the only place to eat when you 're staying in New York.

definitions.definition: officially recognized but not existing in reality

examples.text: He's party leader in name only.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that somebody is famous

examples.text: Here she is, the one and only Rihanna!

definitions.definition: used before mentioning a worry or problem you have with something

examples.text: I'd love to come—the only thing is I might be late.
